entries.meaning: comparative form of chill: more chill
examples: With the setting of the sun a strong breeze, every blast of which was chiller and chiller, had begun to blow, rustling with a low continuous hum . . .

entries.meaning: a machine that produces cold air, either for air conditioning, to prepare chilled foods etc.
a heat exchanger between a coolant and a refrigerant, to transfer heat from the coolant loop into the refrigeration system
A machine that removes heat from the working fluid in a refrigeration cycle
A frightening dramatic work, such as a book or film
